recipes.title: Samosa
recipes.description: Samosa is a popular Indian snack that features a crispy, golden-brown pastry filled with a spiced mixture of mashed potatoes, peas, and sometimes meat. It's deep-fried to perfection, resulting in a delightful combination of crunchy exterior and flavorful interior.
instructions: In a pan, heat oil and add cumin seeds. Once they splutter, add ginger-garlic paste.
Add mashed potatoes, boiled peas, and all the spices. Mix well and cook for a few minutes.
Allow the filling to cool. Take samosa wrappers and form cones, fill with the potato mixture.
Seal the edges and deep-fry until golden brown.
Serve hot with mint chutney or tamarind sauce.

recipes.title: Chole Bhature
recipes.description: Chole Bhature is a classic North Indian dish consisting of spicy chickpeas (chole) served with deep-fried bread (bhature). The chickpeas are cooked in a flavorful tomato-based curry, while the bhature are soft and fluffy deep-fried bread that complements the spiciness of the chole.
ingredients: For Bhature: 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 cup yogurt, 1 teaspoon baking powder, Salt, Oil for frying

Add ginger-garlic paste, tomato puree, and all the spices. Cook until the oil separates.
Add boiled chickpeas and simmer until the curry thickens.
For Bhature: Mix all-purpose flour, yogurt, baking powder, and salt to form a soft dough. Allow it to rest.
Roll the dough into small balls and deep-fry until puffed and golden.
Serve Chole with Bhature, garnished with chopped coriander leaves.
